intro: Psydrax forsteri, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
